question: Which union ministry has launched Swaccha Survakshan Grameen?
explanation: In New Delhi, the Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat launched the Indiaâ€™s largest sanitation survey - Swachh Survekshan Grameen-2019. The aim of this 45-day long survey is to engage rural communities in improvement of the sanitation status of their districts and states through intensive campaign. The survey will take place in 18 thousand villages of 698 districts. Swachhata activities have also been planned at around 87 thousand public places where community meetings will be organized. People can also directly give their feedback through the mobile app. Under the 2nd edition of Swachh Survekshan Grameen, districts and states will be ranked on data collected from citizen feedback, direct observation and service-level progress.
